Package edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.device

The device package represents all of the resources available on an FPGA device (part name, tiles, primitive sites and routing resources).

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Device This is the main class that stores information about each Xilinx part.
DeviceFilesCreator This class has a number of static methods to create Device and WireEnumerator objects from XDLRC files.
PIPRouteThrough This class is used to represent the Route-Through constructs of XDLRC/XDL in association with PIPs.
PrimitivePinMap This is a helper class to help keep the Device files compact.
PrimitiveSite This class represents the primitive sites found in XDLRC files.
SinkPin Keeps track of tile offsets for switch matrix sinks in Device/Tile class.
Tile This class represents the same information found and described in XDLRC files concerning Xilinx FPGA tiles.
Utils This class serves as a method to translate Strings to and from PrimitiveTypes and TileTypes.
V5RAMBPatch This class is used to patch missing information in the XDLRC primitive pins, specificially for RAMB types.
Wire A Wire is describes simply as an integer representing the wire and a row/column tile offset from the source wire.
WireEnumerator This utility class creates and governs the translation of the wires enumeration value from its actual name.
XDLRCParser This class is designed to parse the XDLRC files to create the compact device files used by XDL Tools.
 

Enum Summary
PrimitiveType This enum enumerates all of the Primitive types of the following FPGA families: virtex4 virtex5 virtex6 spartan3a spartan3adsp spartan3e spartan6
TileType This enum enumerates all of the Tile types of the following FPGA families: virtex4 virtex5 virtex6 spartan3a spartan3adsp spartan3e spartan6
WireDirection  
WireType  
 

Package edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.device Description

The device package represents all of the resources available on an FPGA device (part name, tiles, primitive sites and routing resources). All information about FPGA devices is parsed from XDLRC and placed in compact device files for faster loading. See Technical Report and Documentation for more information.
